items.stem: Which setup increases torque at the output?

rationale.correct: Higher gear ratios trade speed for torque at the output.

distractors.A: Correct: torque increases as ratio increases (neglecting losses).
distractors.B: Lower ratio increases speed, not torque.
distractors.C: Direct drive provides 1:1 ratio; no torque multiplication.
distractors.D: Belts transmit power but ratio/efficiency vary; not inherently increasing torque.

items.stem: PWM primarily controls DC motor speed by varying what?

rationale.correct: Duty cycle determines average voltage seen by the motor.

distractors.A: Instantaneous voltage toggles; average is set by duty cycle.
distractors.C: Frequency can matter but duty cycle is primary for speed.
distractors.D: Phase shift is not the standard mechanism for DC motor speed control.

items.stem: Increasing integral gain (I) typically reduces steady-state error but may...

rationale.correct: Integral accumulates error; excessive I can cause oscillations and instability.

distractors.A: Overshoot often increases with high I.
distractors.B: Noise immunity is more influenced by D; integral can worsen noise sensitivity.
distractors.D: Derivative action is independent of integral gain.
